intro: Stylidium roseum, commonly known as the pink stickyseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright pink flowers. The plant produces small, sticky seeds that adhere to animals, aiding in its dispersal. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Stylidium roseum is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
